bio:treatment.description: Petiole 10--70 cm. Blade broadly triangular to sometimes ovate, 2--3-pinnate-pinnatifid at base, 20--80 × 20--70 cm; blades, rachises, and costae sparsely pilose to glabrous abaxially. Pinnae (proximal) ovate-lanceolate or triangular, distal pinnae oblong; terminal segment of each pinna ca. 6--15 times longer than wide, longer ultimate segments 1--2 times their width apart, ca. 2--5 mm wide. Pinnules at 45--60° angle to costa; fertile ultimate segments adnate or equally decurrent and surcurrent. Outer indusia entire to somewhat erose, glabrous.

statement.text: In barrens and open pine or oak woods in acid, often sandy soil, abundant, forming large colonies;
